net.sf.michaelo.dirctxsrc

Class DirContextSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.michaelo.dirctxsrc.DirContextSource

  • public class DirContextSource
extends Object
    A JNDI directory context factory returning ready-to-use DirContext objects. The basic idea is borrowed from DataSource where you get a database connection. Same does this class with directory contexts. This directory context source has built-in support for anonymous and GSS-API with Kerberos 5 authentication. If you intend to use the latter, make sure that your environment is properly configured.

    Here is a minimal example how to create a DirContextSource with the supplied builder: 

     DirContextSource.Builder builder = new DirContextSource.Builder("ldap://hostname");
 DirContextSource contextSource = builder.build();
 // try and catch block omitted for the sake of brevity, handle NamingException appropriately
 DirContext context = contextSource.getDirContext();
 // Perform operations
 context.close();
    Before returning a DirContext the source will loop several times until a connection has been established or the number of retries are exhausted, whichever comes first.

    A DirContextSource object will be initially preconfigured by its builder for you:

    1. The context factory is set by default to com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory.
    2. The default authentication scheme is set to none/anonymous.
    3. If GSS-API authentication is used the login entry name defaults to DirContextSource.
    4. By default a context source will try once to connect and will wait for 2000 ms between retries.

    A complete overview of all DirContext properties can be found here. Make sure that you pass reasonable/valid values only otherwise the behavior is undefined.

      • getDirContext

        public DirContext getDirContext()
                         throws NamingException
        Returns a ready-to-use DirContext. Do not forget to close the context after all operations.
        Returns:
        a DirContext
        Throws:
        NamingException - thrown if a problem with the creation arises
